page.title: 01BUCKFAST & BUCKFASTLEIGH
page.content: The{Dart}rushing by serene and majestic.{Abbey}with new pedestrian layout and rediscovered hall-fit for kings and on past thatched cottage. {Little Chef}to station with hiss of steam and engine whistle flanking old{Buckfastleigh,}nestling in Mardle valley, under Dartmoor's brow. Gone the clanking mill machines and tall chimneys three, the support of families. The ghost of Bigadon points to the new.Growing,the town crawled up hillsides to better views and freer air.New jobs replace the old,pasties for Wales,sea foods to foreign climes,but still the merry song of anvil,while processed flieces bring warmth to many feet and yarn for carpets told.Stone for plaque of roads is found. Hamlyn Hall,with rounds of drama, badminton and jumble sales,listen to
